intro: Oenothera actopanensis, commonly known as the Actopan evening primrose, is a species native to central Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Oenothera actopanensis is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other evening primroses. It is adapted to grow in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands.
